clinical_study.brief_title: Sleep, Physical Activity and Multiple Sclerosis Symptoms in Pediatric Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Sleep, Physical Activity and Multiple Sclerosis Symptoms in Pediatric Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: Most youth with MS experience symptoms such as depression and fatigue. In addition, cognitive issues, especially with attention and memory occur frequently. However, little is known about interventions that might work to improve these symptoms. In other work. the investigators have shown that higher levels of physical activity are associated with lower levels of depression and fatigue. Importantly, sleep problems are frequently encountered in youth with MS, and were seen in 60% of surveyed youth with MS in the investigators preliminary work. Whether sleep plays an important role in symptoms in youth with MS, and the relationship between sleep and physical activity in youth with MS is unknown.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality, duration and timing of sleep will be determined by wearing the Actiwatch for 24 hours/day for seven days.
Children's Behavior Check List Sleep Composite
Physical activity will be observed through wearing an Accelerometer daily for 7-days.
The Varni Pediatric Multidimensional Fatigue Scale (PedsQL-MFS)
primary_outcome.description: A validated 18-item, self-rated symptom-oriented scale suitable for youths aged eight-18 that includes fatigue subscales (total, general, sleep/rest and cognitive fatigue).
A validated scale for children that will be used to derive contextual information about daytime fatigue as it relates to sleep.

primary_outcome.measure: The Centre for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale Children's Rating Scale (CES-DC)
primary_outcome.description: A 20-item, self-rated, symptom-oriented scale suitable for people aged six to 23.

primary_outcome.measure: Neurological Exam Standard physical exam performed by neurologist to determine the Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) score

primary_outcome.description: Series of questions about the participant's demographic and clinical information including, current and past health, family history, and medications.

primary_outcome.measure: Flanker Test of Attention and Concentration

study_pop.textblock: There will be a total of 60 participants in this study. The study population consists of both patients (pediatric-onset multiple sclerosis) and non-patient participants (healthy volunteers).
